intro: Memecylon arcuatomarginatum var. simulans, commonly known as the narrow-leaved memecylon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of India and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom during the rainy season. This variant is distinguished by its narrower leaf margins compared to the typical form of Memecylon arcuatomarginatum.
